messages.title: What's at stake at this Election?
messages.content: Supporting better funding for our schools, Improving Local Transport, Promoting Jobs and Enterprise, Protecting the Environment, Supporting Local Health Provision, Strengthening Community Life

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Supporting better funding for our schools

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Secured millions in Government funding for Congleton Link Road, Middlewich Bypass and pothole repairs.
Support local businesses, visit them to understand their concerns and help troubleshoot problems such as better broadband.
Committed to plastic use reduction, cleaner air, and protecting local green spaces.
More funding for GP services, better provision of mental health care, dementia care as well as respite help for carers, and to keep hospital A&E services.
Working with local charities & community groups, such as the Congleton Allotment Society & supporting the Congleton Youth Orchestra.

issues.education: Education Minister Nick Gibb said 'I'll pay tribute to her. Fiona introduced minimum per pupil funding.'
issues.environment: Was an early supporter of the call for a Government committment to Net Zero emissions.
issues.health: More funding for GP services, decent provision for mental health with dementia care as well as respite help for carers.

leaflet.personalStatement: It has been a privilege and an honour to serve this Constituency for almost ten years and I want to thank you for putting your trust in me and for the generosity of community spirit that is so evident here. This makes a real difference to the lives of local people in so many ways.

images.caption: Fiona Bruce engaging with various community members and stakeholders.
